title: Top 7 stocks with decreasing promoter pledge ratios
summary: Promoters in seven Nifty500 companies reduced pledged shares in Q1FY26, signaling improved financial health and reduced debt reliance. Hindustan Zinc and IRB Infra led with sharp declines, enhancing investor confidence and indicating promoter trust in business fundamentals.​...
fullContent: Promoters in seven Nifty500 companies reduced pledged shares in Q1FY26, signaling improved financial health and reduced debt reliance. Hindustan Zinc and IRB Infra led with sharp declines, enhancing investor confidence and indicating promoter trust in business fundamentals.​

title: Hong Kong’s Peninsula Hotels sees surge in ‘bleisure’ travellers
summary: Hong Kong has welcomed a new wave of travellers combining business and leisure, who have revitalised the city’s luxury hotel sector, according to Benjamin Vuchot, the executive director and CEO of Hong Kong and Shanghai Hotels (HSH), operator of The Peninsula Hotels.
fullContent: Hong Kong has welcomed a new wave of travellers combining business and leisure, who have revitalised the city’s luxury hotel sector, according to Benjamin Vuchot, the executive director and CEO of Hong Kong and Shanghai Hotels (HSH), operator of The Peninsula Hotels. “The opportunity is primarily driven by business trips, but it evolves into leisure as well,” Vuchot said in an interview with the Post on Wednesday. “That’s a very important trend from a growth perspective.” He noted that what...

title: Chile’s Peso Tumbles on ‘Storm Prep’ From Surprise Reserves Plan
summary: Chile’s peso tumbled Wednesday on central bank plans to boost international reserves by about 40%, a development that surprised investors given the institution had repeatedly said it was comfortable with the amount it held.
fullContent: Chile’s peso tumbled Wednesday on central bank plans to boost international reserves by about 40%, a development that surprised investors given the institution had repeatedly said it was comfortable with the amount it held.

title: US stocks tick higher on Fed rate cut hopes; earnings in focus
summary: The S&P 500 and Nasdaq saw gains, fueled by positive corporate earnings and anticipation of Federal Reserve rate cuts. McDonald's and Arista Networks led the charge with strong sales and revenue projections, respectively.
fullContent: The S&P 500 and Nasdaq saw gains, fueled by positive corporate earnings and anticipation of Federal Reserve rate cuts. McDonald's and Arista Networks led the charge with strong sales and revenue projections, respectively. However, Advanced Micro Devices and Super Micro Computer faced setbacks, while tariff concerns and uncertainty surrounding Fed appointments lingered in the market.
